intro: Potentilla matsumurae var. apoiensis, commonly known as the Apoiense cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Japan. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils, often in alpine or subalpine habitats. Its leaves are compound, consisting of five oval-shaped leaflets, and it is often found in shaded, moist environments. This variant is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and unique morphological features compared to other Potentilla species.
